Module HW08
Package common

Interface IChatAppConnector

All Superinterfaces:
java.rmi.Remote
All Known Implementing Classes:
ChatAppConnector
public interface IChatAppConnector
extends java.rmi.Remote
An interface to create stubs of chat application users. You can use this interface to create stubs to be put on the discovery server. This is the application level stub of a receiver, not to be confused with IChatAppReceiever which can create chat room level stubs of a receiver.
Author:
Group C

    Fields 
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    static java.lang.String BOUND_NAME
    The name the IChatAppConnector object will be bound to in the RMI Registry.

  • Field Details

    • BOUND_NAME

      static final java.lang.String BOUND_NAME
      The name the IChatAppConnector object will be bound to in the RMI Registry.
      See Also:
      Constant Field Values

  • Method Details

    • getName

      java.lang.String getName() throws java.rmi.RemoteException
      Return the name of this user. In other words, return this user's unique user name. We assume a user's name to be an invariant feature of an IChatAppConnector.
      Returns:
      String representation of the name of this user
      Throws:
      java.rmi.RemoteException - remote exception

    • invite

      void invite​(IChatRoomConnector connector) throws java.rmi.RemoteException
      Invite a remote user to the room represented by connector. This invitation feature supports an auto-accept feature. When a remote IChatAppConnector receives an invitation, they would automatically connect to the room they were invited to. You do not need to accept an invitation in this design.
      Parameters:
      connector - an instance of a wrapper interface of a chat room connector
      Throws:
      java.rmi.RemoteException - remote exception

    • request

      java.util.List<IChatRoomConnector> request() throws java.rmi.RemoteException
      Request all of the rooms that a remote user is in. If a local user wants to join one of the rooms, they can simply join by sending all receivers in the room an IJoinMessage. It is not necessary to ask for permission to join a room.
      Returns:
      a list of IChatRoomConnectors representing all of the rooms a remote user is in
      Throws:
      java.rmi.RemoteException - remote exception

    • autoConnect

      void autoConnect​(IChatAppConnector connector) throws java.rmi.RemoteException
      Auto connects back to a connector upon connection.
      Parameters:
      connector - connector stub of user who just connected to you
      Throws:
      java.rmi.RemoteException - remote exception

    • getIChatAppConnectors

      java.util.List<IChatAppConnector> getIChatAppConnectors() throws java.rmi.RemoteException
      Gets all IChatAppConnectors that this connector is connected to.
      Returns:
      a list of IChatAppConnectors this connector is connected to
      Throws:
      java.rmi.RemoteException - remote exception

    • disconnect

      void disconnect​(IChatAppConnector connector) throws java.rmi.RemoteException
      Disconnects from the application with the stub, connector.
      Parameters:
      connector - stub of person who closed their application
      Throws:
      java.rmi.RemoteException - remote exception
